intro: Arabis belmuntis, commonly known as the Belmunt's rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters, often in spring. Arabis belmuntis is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
